title: TAREA 02
text:
Supongamos una arquitectura 2-3-2-2

Dibuja dicha red neuronal


pip install graphviz


from graphviz import Digraph

def plot_neural_network(n_inputs, n_outputs, hidden_layers):
    """
    Plot a neural network architecture diagram
    
    Parameters:
    -----------
    n_inputs : int
        Number of input neurons
    n_outputs : int
        Number of output neurons
    hidden_layers : list of int
        List containing the number of neurons in each hidden layer
        Example: [4, 3] means 2 hidden layers with 4 and 3 neurons respectively
    
    Returns:
    --------
    graphviz.Digraph
        A Digraph object that can be rendered or displayed
    
    Example:
    --------
    >>> nn = plot_neural_network(3, 2, [4, 3])
    >>> nn.render('neural_network', format='png', view=True)
    """
    
    dot = Digraph(comment='Neural Network Architecture')
    dot.attr(rankdir='LR', splines='line')
    dot.attr('node', shape='circle', fixedsize='true', width='0.6')
    
    # Create all layers
    all_layers = [n_inputs] + hidden_layers + [n_outputs]
    layer_names = ['Entrada'] + [f'Capa {i+1}' for i in range(len(hidden_layers))] + ['Salida']
    
    # Add nodes for each layer
    for layer_idx, (n_neurons, layer_name) in enumerate(zip(all_layers, layer_names)):
        with dot.subgraph() as s:
            s.attr(rank='same')
            
            # Set color based on layer type
            if layer_idx == 0:
                color = 'lightblue'
            elif layer_idx == len(all_layers) - 1:
                color = 'lightgreen'
            else:
                color = 'lightyellow'
            
            # Add neurons for this layer
            for neuron_idx in range(n_neurons):
                node_id = f'L{layer_idx}_N{neuron_idx}'
                label = f'{layer_name}\n{neuron_idx+1}' if n_neurons <= 5 else ''
                s.node(node_id, label=label, style='filled', fillcolor=color)
    
    # Add edges between consecutive layers
    for layer_idx in range(len(all_layers) - 1):
        n_curr = all_layers[layer_idx]
        n_next = all_layers[layer_idx + 1]
        
        for i in range(n_curr):
            for j in range(n_next):
                dot.edge(f'L{layer_idx}_N{i}', f'L{layer_idx+1}_N{j}', 
                        color='gray', arrowsize='0.5')
    
    # Add layer labels
    dot.attr(label=f'Red Neuronal: {n_inputs} → {" → ".join(map(str, hidden_layers))} → {n_outputs}',
             fontsize='16', labelloc='t')
    
    return dot


nn = plot_neural_network(n_inputs=2, n_outputs=2, hidden_layers=[3, 2])
nn.render('red_neuronal', format='png', view=True, cleanup=True)




RedNeuronal1



¿Cuántos parámetros tiene?
Intermedia 1: 3(2+1) = 33 = 9 Intermedia 2: 2(3+1) = 24 = 8 Salida: 2(2+1) = 2*3 = 6 TOTAL: 9 + 8 + 6 = 23
Si la capa 1 cumple

\(w_{1}^{(1)}=(0.6,-0.4)\) y sesgo \(b_{1}^{(1)}=0.2\)
\(w_{1}^{(2)}=(-0.1,0.5)\) y sesgo \(b_{1}^{(2)}=-0.3\)
\(w_{1}^{(3)}=(0.7,0.2)\) y sesgo \(b_{1}^{(3)}=0.1\)

¿Quiénes son \(W_1\) y \(\boldsymbol{b}_1\)?

\(W_1=\left(\begin{matrix}0.6&-0.4\\-0.1&0.5\\0.7&0.2\end{matrix}\right)\)
\(\boldsymbol{b}_1=\left(\begin{matrix}0.2&-0.3&0.1\end{matrix}\right)\)

Si la capa 2 cumple

\(W_2=\left(\begin{matrix}0.4&-0.6&0.3\\-0.5&0.1&0.8\end{matrix}\right)\) , \(b_2=\left(\begin{matrix}-0.2&0.4\end{matrix}\right)\)

¿Quienes son los pesos de su segunda neurona y cual es el sesgo de la primera? \(w_2^{(2)}\left(\begin{matrix}-0.5&0.1&0.8\end{matrix}\right)\) , \(\boldsymbol{b_2^{(1)}}=-0.2\)
¿Cuántas neuronas tiene la capa de salida? ¿Cuántos pesos y sesgos tiene?

Neuronas: \(w_{out}=2\)
Pesos: \(W_{out}=4\)
Sesgos: \(\boldsymbol{b_{out}}=2\)

Crea tu propia matriz de pesos para la capa de salida y los sesgos de sus neuronas.

\(W_{out}=\left(\begin{matrix}-0.6&0.2\\0.1&-0.1\end{matrix}\right)\) , \(\boldsymbol{b_{out}}=\left(\begin{matrix}0.4&-0.2\end{matrix}\right)\)

title: TAREA 02
text:
Supongamos una arquitectura 2-3-2-2

Dibuja dicha red neuronal


pip install graphviz


from graphviz import Digraph

def plot_neural_network(n_inputs, n_outputs, hidden_layers):
    """
    Plot a neural network architecture diagram
    
    Parameters:
    -----------
    n_inputs : int
        Number of input neurons
    n_outputs : int
        Number of output neurons
    hidden_layers : list of int
        List containing the number of neurons in each hidden layer
        Example: [4, 3] means 2 hidden layers with 4 and 3 neurons respectively
    
    Returns:
    --------
    graphviz.Digraph
        A Digraph object that can be rendered or displayed
    
    Example:
    --------
    >>> nn = plot_neural_network(3, 2, [4, 3])
    >>> nn.render('neural_network', format='png', view=True)
    """
    
    dot = Digraph(comment='Neural Network Architecture')
    dot.attr(rankdir='LR', splines='line')
    dot.attr('node', shape='circle', fixedsize='true', width='0.6')
    
    # Create all layers
    all_layers = [n_inputs] + hidden_layers + [n_outputs]
    layer_names = ['Entrada'] + [f'Capa {i+1}' for i in range(len(hidden_layers))] + ['Salida']
    
    # Add nodes for each layer
    for layer_idx, (n_neurons, layer_name) in enumerate(zip(all_layers, layer_names)):
        with dot.subgraph() as s:
            s.attr(rank='same')
            
            # Set color based on layer type
            if layer_idx == 0:
                color = 'lightblue'
            elif layer_idx == len(all_layers) - 1:
                color = 'lightgreen'
            else:
                color = 'lightyellow'
            
            # Add neurons for this layer
            for neuron_idx in range(n_neurons):
                node_id = f'L{layer_idx}_N{neuron_idx}'
                label = f'{layer_name}\n{neuron_idx+1}' if n_neurons <= 5 else ''
                s.node(node_id, label=label, style='filled', fillcolor=color)
    
    # Add edges between consecutive layers
    for layer_idx in range(len(all_layers) - 1):
        n_curr = all_layers[layer_idx]
        n_next = all_layers[layer_idx + 1]
        
        for i in range(n_curr):
            for j in range(n_next):
                dot.edge(f'L{layer_idx}_N{i}', f'L{layer_idx+1}_N{j}', 
                        color='gray', arrowsize='0.5')
    
    # Add layer labels
    dot.attr(label=f'Red Neuronal: {n_inputs} → {" → ".join(map(str, hidden_layers))} → {n_outputs}',
             fontsize='16', labelloc='t')
    
    return dot


nn = plot_neural_network(n_inputs=2, n_outputs=2, hidden_layers=[3, 2])
nn.render('red_neuronal', format='png', view=True, cleanup=True)




RedNeuronal1



¿Cuántos parámetros tiene?
Intermedia 1: 3(2+1) = 33 = 9 Intermedia 2: 2(3+1) = 24 = 8 Salida: 2(2+1) = 2*3 = 6 TOTAL: 9 + 8 + 6 = 23
Si la capa 1 cumple

\(w_{1}^{(1)}=(0.6,-0.4)\) y sesgo \(b_{1}^{(1)}=0.2\)
\(w_{1}^{(2)}=(-0.1,0.5)\) y sesgo \(b_{1}^{(2)}=-0.3\)
\(w_{1}^{(3)}=(0.7,0.2)\) y sesgo \(b_{1}^{(3)}=0.1\)

¿Quiénes son \(W_1\) y \(\boldsymbol{b}_1\)?

\(W_1=\left(\begin{matrix}0.6&-0.4\\-0.1&0.5\\0.7&0.2\end{matrix}\right)\)
\(\boldsymbol{b}_1=\left(\begin{matrix}0.2&-0.3&0.1\end{matrix}\right)\)

Si la capa 2 cumple

\(W_2=\left(\begin{matrix}0.4&-0.6&0.3\\-0.5&0.1&0.8\end{matrix}\right)\) , \(b_2=\left(\begin{matrix}-0.2&0.4\end{matrix}\right)\)

¿Quienes son los pesos de su segunda neurona y cual es el sesgo de la primera? \(w_2^{(2)}\left(\begin{matrix}-0.5&0.1&0.8\end{matrix}\right)\) , \(\boldsymbol{b_2^{(1)}}=-0.2\)
¿Cuántas neuronas tiene la capa de salida? ¿Cuántos pesos y sesgos tiene?

Neuronas: \(w_{out}=2\)
Pesos: \(W_{out}=4\)
Sesgos: \(\boldsymbol{b_{out}}=2\)

Crea tu propia matriz de pesos para la capa de salida y los sesgos de sus neuronas.

\(W_{out}=\left(\begin{matrix}-0.6&0.2\\0.1&-0.1\end{matrix}\right)\) , \(\boldsymbol{b_{out}}=\left(\begin{matrix}0.4&-0.2\end{matrix}\right)\)
